definitions: Theodor Eicke (1892-1943) was a German SS-Obergruppenführer during the Nazi era. He was a commander of the SS Division Totenkopf of the Waffen-SS and one of the key figures in the establishment of concentration camps in Nazi Germany.
A prominent figure in the Nazi regime, known for his brutal efficiency and role in the development and administration of the concentration camp system.
examples: Theodor Eicke was instrumental in the creation of the concentration camp system.
Historians often discuss Theodor Eicke's role in the SS.
The SS Division Totenkopf was commanded by Theodor Eicke.
